summary: The concept of "notification of a vacancy," commonly referred to as "job vacancy," pertains to the systematic dissemination of information regarding available positions in the labour market. This process involves the compilation and transmission of vacancies, which are collected and reported quarterly to ensure coherence and facilitate comparison across different units. The modalities for notification specify deadlines and formats to enhance the feasibility of job searches. Statistical studies adjust for seasonal variations and provide essential insights into trends and dimensions of employment. The quality of this data is crucial for interpreting labour market dynamics and addressing difficulties in job placement across the EU.
